{{Infobox settlement | official_name = Islamkot | name = {{Nastaliq|'''اسلام ڪوٽ'''}} | native_name = {{native name|mki|اسلام ڪوٽ}} | settlement_type = Taluka | image_skyline = | imagesize = 300px | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_map = Islamkot.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = [[Pakistan]] | subdivision_type1 = [[Subdivisions of Pakistan|Province]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Sindh]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Districts of Pakistan#Sindh|District]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Tharparkar District|Tharparkar]] | population_total = 244,662 | population_as_of = 2017 | population_est = Above 244,662 | pop_est_as_of = | population_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = | population_density_km2 = | area_code = 0232-263xxx | area_code_type = [[List of dialling codes of Pakistan|Calling code]] | timezone1 = [[Pakistan Standard Time|PST]] | utc_offset1 = +5 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Islamkot''' ({{lang-ur|{{Nastaliq|اِسلام كوٹ}}}}), ({{lang|sd-arab|Sindhi: اسلام ڪوٽ}}) is a [[taluka]] in the [[Tharparkar District]] in [[Sindh]], [[Pakistan]]. Hundreds of [[Azadirachta indica|neem]] trees seen on Islamkot-[[Mithi]], Islamkot-[[Chachro]] and Islamkot-[[Nagarparkar]] roads were planted during chairmanship of Nihalchand Pabani and under his care. For the same reason this region is also known as the [[Neem tree]] region.{{Cite web|url=http://santnenuram.org/Aashram/AboutSant/SethNihalChand.html|title=Biography of Seth Nihalchand|website=Sant Nenuram Ashram}} The [[Hinduism|Hindu]] [[sadhu|saint]] ''"Shri Sant Nenuram"'' was born here and Sant Nenuram Ashram located in this region was established by Nihalchand Pabani with support of local people. Each day twice free meal is served throughout the year in Sant Nenuram Ashram in form of "[[Bhandara (community kitchen)|Bhandhara]]" which is available for everyone.{{Cite news|url=http://www.pakvoices.pk/nenu-ram-ashram-a-place-of-refuge-for-everyone/|title=Nenu Ram Ashram: A place of refuge for everyone|last=Akash Hamirani|first=Bashir Ahmad|date=April 26, 2018|work=Pak Voices|access-date=}} A huge number of people from different caste (Suthar, Lohana, Mukhi, Maharaj, Maheshwari, Soni, Meghwar, Khaskheli, Bajeer, Kunbhar, Lohaar etc.), creed, race or religion avail this meal on daily basis and during annual three-day festival of Sant thousands of devotees attend and celebrate it, including both [[Hinduism|Hindus]] and [[Muslims]].{{Cite news|url=http://pakistan.asia-news.com/en_GB/articles/cnmi_pf/features/2018/10/30/feature-02|title=Sindh festival promotes religious harmony|last=Zia Ur Rehman|first=|date=2018-10-30|work=Pakistan Forward|access-date=}} There are 10 primary boys school and a higher secondary school, and also three girls primary school and a girls high school. The city is well connected with the other large cities like [[Karachi]] and [[Hyderabad, Pakistan|Hyderabad]]. The name of the city translates as "Islam Fort". [[Civil Aviation Authority of Pakistan]] is building the [[Islamkot International Airport]] here.[http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=84717 Islamkot Airport] {{bar box | title = Religions in Islamkot | titlebar = #Fcd116 | left1 = Religion | right1 = Percent | float = right | bars = {{bar percent|[[Hinduism]]|orange|90}} {{bar percent|[[Islam]]|green|10}} }}
